title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
I have an A1534 which came in with a broken screen and a flat battery. The screen assembly was replaced and it doesn't seem to have any signs of life apart from the led on the board.

I've checked the basics but I'm at a loss. It was with another company first but they apparently "hadn't touched it" (Although the trackpad connector flap had gone missing)

8.63v PPBUS_G3H
14.67v PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H
8.63v PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS
14.69v PPVBUS_LIO
14.69v PPDCIN_G3H
3.29v PP3V3_G3H
3.29v PP3V3R3V0_AON
4.96v PP5V_G3H

Any ideas where to start from here?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
PP5v_S5 = 5.0v
PP3v3_S5 = 3.32v
PP3v3_SUS = 3.3v

PP3v3_S4 is boosting to 3.37v every 4 seconds

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.29v

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
PPVCORE_SUS_PCH = 1.001v
PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1 & PH2 0.00v
PM_SLP_S4_L = 3.35v pulses every 4 seconds

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
Check if PM_SLP_S3_L pulses too.
Then check if all voltages controlled by these signals also pulse.
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is pulsing?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Okay, I’ll check that tomorrow. 11 hours until work as there’s a time difference unfortunately

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: PM_SLP_S3_L and ALL_SYS_PWRGD are also pulsing

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Followed PM_SLP_S3_L into U8170, PP1v8_S3 going into U8170 is also pulsing

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Check if ALL S3 and S0 voltages try to appear.

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: So far nothing on S0

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: My bad.. was on the wrong component.. PP5v_S0 is pulsing.. checking the rest

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
So I get pulsing on all of these:  PP5v_S0, PP3v3_S0, PP1V5_S0

Anything I've missed?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
You should have more S0 voltages.
Not always marked as S0, but check every secondary supply enabled by PM_SLP_S3_L, or a derivate of it.
Can you see any pulse on CPU VCORE?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Theres no pulse on VCORE

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: On U8230 I had a constant 5v out for PP5v_S0 for a minute until I moved the board to recheck the first place that I checked PP5v_S0. I'm now back to pulsing though :(

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Do you note any sign of liquid on the LCD connector?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
U8220 - PP3v3_sus out is 3.3v constant
U8230 - PP5v_S0 is pulsing
U8200 - PP3v3_S4 is pulsing
U8210 - PP3v3_s0 is pulsing
U8250 - PP1v8_s3 is pulsing
U8240 - PP1v2_s0sw is pulsing
U8270 - PP1v_s3 / sus is 1v constant
U8206 - PP1v_s0sw 1v constant

Are these what you mean?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: There's nothing on there under a microscope. The trackpad looks like it may have seen a touch of liquid at one edge but nothing major

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: PM_SLP_S5_L is pulsing also

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
PM_DSW_PWRGD is constant 
CPU_VCCST_PWRGD is pulsing
ALL_SYS_PWRGD is pulsing
SMC_PM_G2_EN is constant 3.3v

So maybe U7800 issue?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
Bad screen can means dropped machine.
This could caused broken solder/traces; possibly nightmare...

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Could be. I was told that the boyfriend hit the screen. I still don't understand what it is telling me by pulsing

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
Pulsing voltage means respective power supplies receive enable and generate voltage.
For some reason power sequence is not completed.
SMC can detect a fault, or maybe PCH doesn't work as should be.
Try to start in SMC bypass mode, just in case...

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: SMC bypass on these... is that with the board back in and battery connected or without the battery?  Hold power button for 10 seconds and keep holding for another 10 seconds while plugging in the power lead right?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message:
Something like that.
Good enough to test...

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Nothing from this board when I try to bypass SMC

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Do I need the battery connected for SMC bypass or does it not matter on these?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode without battery connected?

title: 820-00687 doesn't seem to turn on
message: Yeah. No life but a board LED in both cases
